comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: A fine view of the Headstone Viaduct over the River Wye.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The leftmost arch is either still under construction or being repaired in this shot. Here are some similar, more recent views from Monsal Head, taken from a little higher up: www.monsalhead.co.uk/

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/artolog] 
Well spotted.  That site you've linked mentions slippage and consequent repairs in 1907-08.  Do you think that's what we see here?

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I saw that too, but according to LOC these were taken in the last decade of the 19th Century.  I'm not sure when this was originally built.

comment.author: 31580040@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/artolog] Originally built 1863. I wonder how approximate the dates are. The note above that refers to Title from the Detroit Publishing Co., Catalogue J--foreign section, Detroit, Mich. : Detroit Publishing Company, 1905. seems to imply it isn't that repair.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: imac-photosfromthemindseye.blogspot.com/2009/03/monsal-he... has some recent (2009) views of Monsal Dale and the viaduct.
